In a message dated 6/5/2004 10:01:01 PM Eastern Standard Time, 
secretarytocapt3@... writes:
Translate that Seinan War newspaper article on 3-hajime/1to5.net
please....
I still can't quiet understand the replies to my messages on 
http://www.3-hajime.com/cgi-local/patio/patio.cgi?mode=view&no=16
and 
http://www.tamahito.com/whoswho.htm (which mentions ANOTHER Saitou
Hajime in the Shinsengumi)
does it REALLY say that Nakajima Nobori grew orchids?  Or is it his
wife's name or something...it is in the same sentence talking about
his firearms shop.  This detail interests me because orchids are very
hard to cultivate ^_^ you really have to have a green thumb to have
them grow successfully.
Actually, what Nakajima Nobori grew was aspidistra! It's a type of a greenery 
that is actually fairly hardy once it gets to going good. At least, that's 
how the system I'm using translates the name.

The other Saito is the guy who was adopted (if I'm reading this right). He 
was apparently some sort of priest or in a priest's family to begin with. He 
took part in the Koshu-Katsunuma fight, but left the remaining Shinsengumi in 
Sendai. He later founded a private elementary school in Tama and remained devoted 
to education-related business until he died in 1874 at 61 years of age. It 
seems doubtful that he was ever part of the group before the beginning of the 
Boshin War.

As for what the translator I use says about Saito's activities? It's not much 
better than the Babelfish, but here it goes:

"...and I utter Morizaki at the third morning, and I many soldiers reach full 
Ichio, too and halve a police superintendent second-rate platoon and I lead a 
half captain Goro Fujita half platoon and put soldiers of the army together 
and I lead progress, a squad long Masato Yusa half platoon and put right ways 
together with army soldier and go over a secret path day flat peak and attack 
it and I outrun and enemy's fortress of Tsuruwa mountain pass and (?) and climb 
Yamagami of an above-ground house. (?) than this and lead a soldier of the 
Goro Fujita right wing and go over Fukuhara Pass and shoot a final phase, an 
enemy's fortress in (?), and, in addition, omission pushes forward a soldier to 
an above-ground house, and (?) bombards this promptly and carries a this time 
Goro Fujita gunshot wound equal to this on my back..."

So it doesn't make much more sense this way than it did the other. That's why 
I like to cross-reference between translators as much as possible. Even then, 
some things remain confusing to me.

-MissBehavin
